毒.definition: poison; to poison; poisonous; malicious; cruel; fierce; narcotics

毒劑.definition: a poison; a toxic agent; poison gas; a chemical weapon

毒化.definition: to poison (usu. figuratively); to debase; to pervert; to harm

毒唯.definition: fan of one particular member of a pop idol band who denigrates and defames the other members

毒奶.definition: poisoned milk; contaminated milk; refers to 2008 PRC scandal involving milk products adulterated with melamine 三聚氰胺[san1 ju4 qing2 an4]

毒奶粉.definition: poisoned milk powder; refers to 2008 PRC scandal involving milk powder adulterated with melamine 三聚氰胺[san1 ju4 qing2 an4]

毒害.definition: to harm (sb's health) with narcotics etc; to poison (people's minds); to corrupt; pernicious influence

毒手.definition: deadly blow; vicious attack; treacherous assault

毒打.definition: to viciously beat (sb) up; CL:頓|顿[dun4]

毒氣.definition: poison gas; toxic gas; manifestation of passion, anger etc (Buddhism)

毒氣彈.definition: poison gas shell; poison gas grenade

毒爪.definition: forcipules (the venomous pair of pincer-like appendages of a centipede)

毒蟲.definition: poisonous insect (or spider etc); venomous snake; (slang) junkie

毒蠅傘.definition: fly Amanita or fly agaric (Amanita muscaria)

毒雞湯.definition: (coll.) profit-motivated article cynically disguised as feel-good content 雞湯|鸡汤[ji1 tang1] and designed to go viral

毒顎.definition: forcipules (the venomous pair of pincer-like appendages of a centipede)

毒駕.definition: to drive under the influence of drugs
